intro: Krebsia carinata, commonly known as the warty beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant has hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Krebsia carinata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in wet or dry conditions.
